string.value: Should I head over to the small grave that serves as the answer to the code written on the bizarre-looking statue? I should--knowing is better than not knowing.
Solving the code took me to this small grave. I better let Kinokonoko knowof this.
I told Kinokonoko everything I knew in regards to this puzzling code.
(In the midst of snow-covered mountains lay a small grave no one notices.)
(The tombstone has something engraved on it, but thanks to the years of weathering, it's barely legible.)
(This code seems to imply the presence of the person that is laid to rest here, but... now it's impossible to even find out exactly who that is.)
(First, I'll have to get back to Kinoko Shrine and let Kino Konoko on this.)
（A small grave covered in snow can be found here, barely noticeable）
Oh, you're back! What happened to the code?
（I told Kinokono what the code implied）
I see... I see! It's hard to fathom, in the middle of a mountain covered in snow lays a small grave. \nIt's hard to find out what the code means, but I'm sure it means something...
But you know, it feels good to finally have the puzzling code solved, because it had been nagging me for quite some time. Great job there. Thanks. Hope to see you around.
(I found a small grave. I'll need to head back to Kinoko Shrine and let Kino Konoko know of the events that unfolded)
